title: Patriots clinch AFC East, but more to play for next week

bullets: New England Patriots For the first time since 2019, the Patriots are AFC East champions.

title: What Stefon Diggs said about closing in on another 1000-yard season
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots With one game left, Diggs needs 30 more yards to get his seventh 1000-yard season in eight years.
Stefon Diggs prior to the start of the Patriots-Jets game on Dec.
28 at MetLife Stadium.

title: Efton Chism seizes moment to help Patriots’ banged-up receiver corps
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "There are hard workers on this team.
I would say none that probably work harder than Efton.
" Efton Chism reeled in two catches for 40 yards and a touchdown on Sunday.

title: Drake Maye’s ‘full-circle’ moment against Jets showed how much Patriots’ fortunes have changed
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Maye made his NFL debut in a blowout loss to New York last year.
On Sunday, the Patriots flipped the script.

title: Christian Barmore blasts Jets player for ‘dirty’ play that led to heated exchange
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “The play was already over.
I heard the whistle blown.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled in lopsided victory over Jets
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Drake Maye, Stefon Diggs, and Jaylinn Hawkins made big plays in the blowout win against New York.
Jaylinn Hawkins Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff The Patriots were dominant from start to finish on Sunday, putting up 21 unanswered points to start the game against the Jets.
New England’s passing game could not be stopped.

title: 8 takeaways from Patriots’ blowout win over the Jets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Drake Maye dominated on Sunday, throwing five touchdowns in less than three full quarters against the Jets.
Drake Maye threw five touchdowns midway through the third quarter.

(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Ryan updated on December 28, 2025 | 4:19 PM 10 minutes to read A shorthanded Patriots roster had no issue grounding the Jets on Sunday, leaving MetLife Stadium with a convincing 42-10 win.

title: Dozens of Mass. convicted murderers have been granted parole, sparking backlash from prosecutors
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The former convicts have received parole as a result of a 2024 court ruling that changed sentencing guidelines for adults under age 21.
The former convicts became eligible for parole after a 2024 Supreme Judicial Court ruling.

Lane Turner/The Boston Globe By Darin Zullo December 28, 2025 | 11:04 AM 2 minutes to read The Massachusetts Parole Board is facing backlash for releasing 39 convicted murderers who recently became eligible for parole after a 2024 court ruling.

title: AG Campbell fines Mass. company $250,000 over ‘noxious odors’ smelled miles from facility
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Environment The food waste recycling plant reportedly violated several state environmental laws, affecting residents miles away.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell's office announced that Feedback Earth, Inc.
in Grafton will be fined up to $250,000.

title: Should Joe Mazzulla be an early favorite for NBA Coach of the Year?
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Celtics Mazzulla has the Celtics positioned as the No.
3 team in the Eastern Conference.
Joe Mazzulla has the celtics positioned to host a first round playoff series if the season ended today.
